expected_answer: RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) combines information retrieval with text generation to produce more accurate and grounded responses.
Vector search finds similar items by comparing their numerical representations (embeddings) in high-dimensional space, typically using cosine similarity or euclidean distance.
Embeddings are dense numerical representations of text that capture semantic meaning, enabling similarity comparisons between documents.
Documents are split into smaller chunks with configurable size and overlap to enable more precise retrieval while maintaining context.
Semantic search finds results based on meaning rather than exact keyword matches, using embeddings to understand query intent.
